class_notes: Introduction to issues in health policy and fundamental for all majors and minors. This course will cover major topics in health policy, with a focus on the United States. We will address the following questions: Why is health care spending going up and should we care? How is health care financed? In what respects does the market for health insurance differ from markets for other types of products? How do Medicare and Medicaid operate? How do doctors and hospitals get paid? How does the organization of US health care inhibit or contribute to value? Is it possible to measure the quality of care?
course_description: The course covers the US health care system, including the factors responsible for increasing health care spending, the purpose of regulation in the individual insurance market, the role of Medicare and Medicaid, and pros and cons of horizontal and vertical integration among providers and hospitals.
